months.name: Month 1
months.focus: Learn the routine, keep scalp clean, avoid over-manipulation.
extras: Take clear starting photos from front, side, and back.
Stick tightly to weekly wash day and bonnet use every night.
On the last Sunday: spend 5 extra minutes massaging scalp with Grapeseed & Avocado Oil.

months.name: Month 2
months.lengthNote: Still short, coils close to the scalp.
extras: Aim for scalp massages with oil at least 3 nights each week.
Last Sunday of the month: keep conditioner on for the full 15 minutes.
Compare new photos to Month 1 and notice thickness, not just length.

months.name: Month 3
months.lengthNote: More defined coils and a little lift.
extras: Focus conditioner on your ends on wash day.
If you see tiny single-strand knots at the very tips, carefully snip just those ends (optional).
End of Month 3: photo check-in + quick note on how your hair feels (dry/soft/itchy/etc.).

months.name: Month 4
months.lengthNote: May approach 2+ inches with good retention.
extras: After wash day, try small twists/coils and keep them in for 4–7 days.
Avoid picking your hair out daily; let the style sit and protect your ends.
If scalp feels product-heavy, rinse well and massage longer with shampoo on wash day.

months.name: Month 5
months.lengthNote: Coils have more movement; twist outs may start to show.
months.focus: Prep for mini twists and longer protective styles.
extras: Once this month, on wash day, finger-detangle thoroughly with conditioner.
End of the month: plan for your first mini-twist attempt in Month 6.
Adjust product amounts if hair feels weighed down (especially DoubleButter Cream).

months.name: Month 6
extras: Pick one wash day to install mini twists and keep them in 1–2 weeks.
Follow the weekly moisture schedule on top of twists instead of loose hair.
Take a side photo of your twists to compare with future months.

months.name: Month 7
months.lengthNote: Twists look fuller and hang a bit more.
extras: Be extra patient taking down twists to avoid snapping ends.
Add 5 extra minutes to conditioner time on the last Saturday.
If you feel buildup on scalp, gently scrub with fingertip pads while shampooing.

months.name: Month 8
months.lengthNote: Hair may stretch to 4–5 inches in some areas.
extras: Keep a protective style in for 7–10 days when possible.
Check for rough, crunchy ends; add a tiny bit more DoubleButter Cream on wash day if needed.
End-of-month photo: gently stretch a small section in the front and back for a length check.

months.name: Month 9
months.lengthNote: Noticeable volume; twist outs show more shape.
months.focus: Refine product amounts and keep scalp happy.
extras: If hair feels greasy or heavy, reduce Leave-In or DoubleButter amounts slightly.
Once this month, do a 10-minute oil scalp massage before wash.
Write down what product combo your hair liked best this month.

months.name: Month 10
months.lengthNote: Stretched length may be 5–6 inches or more.
extras: Keep twists or braids in for up to 2 weeks if they still look neat.
On the last wash day, examine ends and only snip obvious single-strand knots (optional).
Take photos in the same style as Month 1 to see progress clearly.

months.name: Month 11
months.lengthNote: Twists now look longer & fuller; almost ‘medium’ length.
months.focus: Stay consistent — don’t change what works.
extras: Choose one “spa” wash day with 15-minute conditioner time and extra gentle detangling.
If your hairline feels stressed, avoid tight styles this entire month.
End-of-month: write a quick journal note about what your hair likes best.

months.name: Month 12
months.lengthNote: With good retention, you may have 6–7+ inches stretched.
extras: Do a careful wash day with plenty of conditioner and patience with tangles.
Optional: tiny dusting trim of very ends if they look frayed (or see a professional).
Take comparison photos with Month 1 and note your progress.
Decide if you want to keep this routine or adjust for Year 2.

weeklyRoutine.title: Moisture Day
tasks: Lightly mist hair with water if dry.
Apply As I Am Leave-In and smooth through, focusing on ends.
Seal with a small amount of DoubleButter Cream.
If long enough, gently coil or twist small sections (no tight pulling).
Sleep with satin bonnet / scarf.

weeklyRoutine.title: Scalp Care Day
tasks: Part gently with fingers and apply a few drops of Grapeseed & Avocado Oil to scalp.
Massage with fingertips for 3–5 minutes (no nails).
Don’t re-twist or comb. Let style rest.
Bonnet / scarf at night.

weeklyRoutine.title: Mid-Week Moisture
tasks: Lightly mist with water and separate sections with fingers.
Add a bit of Leave-In, then a small amount of DoubleButter Cream to ends.
Finger detangle only. No brush or comb.
Bonnet / scarf at night.

weeklyRoutine.title: Low-Manipulation Day
tasks: No new products unless hair feels dry.
If needed, smooth 1–2 drops of Grapeseed & Avocado Oil over top and ends.
Do not comb, brush, or restyle.
Bonnet / scarf at night.

weeklyRoutine.title: Pre-Wash Prep + Scalp Massage
tasks: If hair feels dry, add a small amount of Leave-In and DoubleButter Cream to ends.
Apply a few drops of Grapeseed & Avocado Oil to scalp and massage.
Keep style loose, no tight ponytails or braids.
Bonnet / scarf at night.

weeklyRoutine.title: Wash Day
tasks: Fully wet hair with warm water, gently stretch with fingers.
Shampoo with Honey Creme Shampoo, focusing on scalp. Rinse thoroughly.
Apply SheaMoisture Low Porosity Conditioner from roots to ends and finger-detangle.
Leave conditioner on 10–15 minutes, then rinse with cool/lukewarm water.
On damp hair, apply Leave-In, then DoubleButter Cream to seal.
Add a few drops of Grapeseed & Avocado Oil to scalp and ends. Massage gently.
Style into coils or twists you can keep for several days (as length allows).

weeklyRoutine.title: Rest Day
tasks: Do nothing to your hair unless it feels dry or tight.
If needed, smooth a tiny bit of DoubleButter Cream on ends.
Once a month (see month tabs), use Sunday for pictures and quick check-in.
Bonnet / scarf at night.
